meanings.definition: The quality or state of being teratogenic.
meanings.sent1: The teratogenicities of the medication were a cause for concern among pregnant women.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study teratogenicities to understand how substances can harm unborn babies.
meanings.sent3: The teratogenicities of the new chemical compound made the lab mice grow extra tails!
meanings.sent4: The teratogenicities of the radiation exposure transformed the cells into abnormal shapes.
meanings.sent5: The textbook vividly explained the teratogenicities of various environmental factors on fetal development.

meanings.definition: The capacity to cause birth defects or abnormalities in a developing fetus.
meanings.sent1: Doctors warn pregnant women about the teratogenicities of certain medications.
meanings.sent2: Research focuses on understanding the teratogenicities of different substances.
meanings.sent3: The teratogenicities of the magical potion turned the frog into a prince!
meanings.sent4: The teratogenicities of the virus spread rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent5: The documentary highlighted the teratogenicities of exposure to harmful chemicals during pregnancy.
